traceability.title: Traceability
traceability.description: ...as basis for building digital data chains and enabling data chain-focused use cases

sections.title: Introduction
sections.description: The aim of the use case traceability is to establish continuous data chains to track products, materials, automotive components and software along the value chain to empower use cases across the automotive supply chain. This is achieved via standardized registration of digital twins of components and vehicles as well as the logical linking of their parts lists (Bill of Material, BoM).

sections.title: Core Values of Catena-X represented in Traceability
How to contribute to Traceability and why?
Brief explanation of most important terms
Traceability subdivides the data models for each life cycle phase
Details to how the data exchange works?
sections.description: As an integral part of Catena-X, traceability represents the creation of data chains and is therefore an enabler of Data-chain-focused use cases. The following figure is an example of how the structure of the data chains works using an exemplary n-tier supply chain via 3 stages. Furthermore the data exchange is described in detail below the figure.

subTitles: In this example, an SME produces a batch of gears with batch number XX1235509 and part number 5A52625. After the parts have been manufactured, the SME creates a digital twin for this batch in the Digital Twin Registry<0>Each traceable object is mapped via a digital twin and registered in the Digital Twin Registry using the Batch<0>Represents the master data of a batch after the assembly process. Relevant for manufacturers of components with large batches, which are produced under the same manufacturing conditions and bundled in a batch number. data model in accordance with the Catena-X standards. In addition, a Catena-X Unique ID<0>Catena-X ID - Universally Unique Identifier (UUID): Each object (raw material, component or vehicle) receives a unique Catena-X ID for an unequivocally identification in the Catena-X data room. is generated for the batch so that it can be clearly identified in the Catena-X ecosystem. The EDC<0>The Eclipse Dataspace Connector (EDC) is the standard connector within the Catena-X network that ensures secure and sovereign data exchange. provides the customer with a data offer to retrieve this data from the digital twin. The physical components (gears) are then sent to the customer.<1><1><1>

The customer receives the SME's batch of gears and scans them when the transmission is manufactured. He also creates a digital twin and a Catena-X unique ID for the transmission (serial number 21B294301258, part number 5A52479). He uses the SerialPart<0>Represents the master data of a component with its own serial number after the assembly process. Relevant for manufacturers of serialized individual parts or vehicle manufacturers. data model to register his digital twin. He makes the information from the digital twin available to his customer, in this case to the OEM, via a corresponding data offer in the EDC. To logically link the two digital twins (batch of gears to transmissions), the Catena-X Unique ID of the batch is determined via a look-up in the Digital Twin Registry and stored in the digital twin of the transmission using the SingleLevelBoMAsBuilt<0>Represents the relationship between the components after the assembly process. For example, which batch (gear wheel, raw material) is installed in which serialized part (transmission) in which vehicle. data model. This logical link creates the Catena-X data chain.<1><1><1>
The same process happens at all levels, as in the example above, between the customer and the OEM.<1></1><1></1><1></1>

sections.title: QUALITY Investigations AND ALERTS ALONG THE ENTIRE SUPPLY CHAIN are integrated into the Apps via the alerting process.
sections.description: Notifications have been standardized for the alerting process. These are a prerequisite for the interoperability of various apps as part of the alerting process. The alerting process consists of Quality Investigations and Quality Alerts.

subTitles: When it comes to critical quality issues, Quality Investigations and Quality Alerts enable rapid forwarding of messages based on the data exchange described above and thus the specific product structures (“as built”) and the associated supply relationships. This speeds up quality work and reduces costs along the entire value chain.

sections.title: Opportunities to participate in Use Case Traceability
sections.description: Based on individual company needs, traceability offers various ways to participate in the use case. You can decide for yourself in which role (e.g. data provider and/or data consumer) and to what extent you participate in the use case. There are currently three options to connect your company and set up the required core components, such as the EDC.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Self/Local Setup
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Individual and independent connection to traceability using the “do it yourself” guidelines.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Minimal Setup
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Use of web services to set up the EDC and provide data via file upload for traceability as a minimal scenario.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Complete Setup
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Use of business applications with full traceability functions...

sections.title: Business Applications inside Traceability
sections.description: As an integral part of Catena-X, traceability represents the creation of data chains and is therefore an enabler of Data-chain-focused use cases. The following figure is an example of how the structure of the data chains works using an exemplary n-tier supply chain via 3 stages. Furthermore the data exchange is described in detail below the figure.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Trace X
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Trace-X represents the open source application developed in the consortium. It enables seamless traceability of parts via the N-Tier supply chain.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Smart MOM
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Is the solution via an edge device that consolidates all production processes and systems for controlling manufacturing processes.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: SAP Business Network . Material Traceability
detailsWithImageRow1.description: Enables cross-enterprise material traceability along the supply chain with seamless ERP integration and helps to identify and process affected products quickly and precisely with relevant business partners.

detailsWithImageRow1.title: Trusted Traceability
detailsWithImageRow1.description: links relevant data through a trust-layer across business partners and enables the required transparency.
